meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - I'm diving head-first into the world of LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2, and you know what? It's a groovy ride!

As I jump, smash, and puzzle my way through this intergalactic adventure, I couldn't help but think about my fellow critics. You know, the ones who got to experience this game before me? Yeah, they're probably having a blast too... or maybe not.

Take IGN for instance. They gave it an 80, saying it's "constantly fun to play, especially in co-op." I'm all about that co-op life, folks! But let's be real, who doesn't love playing with friends? It's like they're trying to make me feel guilty for not having a buddy by my side.

GameSpot chimed in with a 70, stating that it's "basic cheerful gameplay and demeanour will make all of those extra pursuits worthwhile." I mean, I guess that's one way to look at it. But honestly, who doesn't love the thrill of collecting every single LEGO minifigure out there?

Gaming Age went a bit more in-depth with an 83, saying that "the cookie cutter formula of taking popular franchises or movies and making them LEGO games still works." Yeah, I mean, it's not like we're asking for much – just a bunch of blocky fun! And hey, if Warner Brothers keeps churning out these games, I'll keep on playing... and collecting.

Cheat Code Central gave it an 82, praising the "roster of over two hundred characters" that are sure to delight. Two hundred?! That's like having an entire LEGO Marvel Super Heroes convention in your hands!

Vandal chimed in with a 77, saying that while there aren't any new features, the game is still very enjoyable. I mean, who needs change when you're already playing with blocks? It's all about the experience, right?

SpazioGames echoed IGN's sentiments with an 80, stating that "Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2 doesn't try to change the Lego formula: instead, it builds up on the benefits of its predecessor..." Yeah, no changes needed here! Just more LEGO magic, please!

Destructoid wrapped things up with a 70, saying that while the game is still fun, the core mechanics remain rooted in the past. Well, I'm okay with that! Sometimes you just need to stick with what works... like my trusty old LEGO hammer.

So there you have it – a groovy review of LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 from this self-proclaimed seasonal critic (wink). If you're looking for fun, adventure, and maybe a little bit of nostalgia, then this game is the perfect fit. Just don't forget to grab your friends and get ready for a block-tastic good time!
